protocol.name: P-MTAB-1507
text: Use “Superscript double stranded cDNA synthesis kit” (Invitrogen, # 11917-010) for cDNA synthesis. The kit provides all reagents needed for the synthesis of ds-cDNA.
Use 5-10µg total RNA in 10 µl, amount of RNA should be constant for all samples.
• Prepare Mastermix of the following reagents for each sample:
0,22  µl spike controls (if using 5 µg RNA, thaw 1:20 stock, dilute 1:50 and heat to 70°C for 10 min before use)
• Add 10 µl Mastermix to each RNA sample (final volume 20µl), mix gently; if necessary spin down briefly
• Prepare Mastermix of the following reagents for each sample
• add 130 µl Mastermix to the 1st strand cDNA (20µl) on ice
• mix gently; if necessary spin down briefly
• incubate at 16°C for 2h (don’t let temperature rise above 16°C)
Affymetrix Probe Synthesis Guidelines, Markus Schmid and Jan Lohmann, MPI Tübingen; page 5 of 8
use the “ GeneChip Sample Cleanup Module” from Affymetrix (Part #900371), READ the manual!
• add 600 µl cDNA binding buffer the the 150 µl 2nd strand reaction
• vortex to mix (color of mix must be yellow!)
• apply the sample mix to a cDNA Cleanup Spin Column sitting in a 2 ml collection tube
• add 750 µl cDNA wash buffer (with EtOH !)
• discard flow through and transfer spin column into new 2ml collection tube
• open cap and spin full speed for 5 min to remove residual EtOH
• transfer spin column into new 1.5 ml collection tube
• pipet 14 µl cDNA Elution Buffer directly onto the membrane and incubate for 1 min
• spin full speed for 1 min to elute (average elution volume is 12 µl)
• ds-cDNA can be stored at –80°C at this point
Affymetrix Probe Synthesis Guidelines, Markus Schmid and Jan Lohmann, MPI Tübingen; page 6 of 8
The “BioArrayHighYield Transcript Labeling Kit” (Enzo; also distributed by Affymetrix) is the system of choice to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA for use with Affymetrix GeneChips.
• Prepare Mastermix of the following reagents for each sample
• add 28 µl Mastermix to 12 µl ds-cDNA (final volume 40 µl) mix gently; if necessary spin down briefly
Affymetrix Probe Synthesis Guidelines, Markus Schmid and Jan Lohmann, MPI Tübingen; page 7 of 8
use the “ GeneChip Sample Cleanup Module” from Affymetrix (Part #900371), READ the manual!
• add 60 µl water (RNase free) to the IVT reaction and vortex
• add 350 µl IVT cRNA Binding Buffer and vortex
• add 250 µl EtOH (99%) to the lysate and mix well by pipetting – do not centrifuge!
• apply sample mix (700µl) to IVT cRNA Cleanup Spin Column sitting in a 2ml collection tube
• add 500 µl IVT cRNA Wash Buffer (with EtOH)
• discard flow through and transfer spin column into new 2ml collection tube
• open cap and spin full speed for 5 min to remove residual EtOH
• transfer spin column into new 1.5 ml collection tube
• pipet 11 µl RNase free water directly onto the membrane and incubate for 1 min
• spin full speed for 1 min to elute
• pipet 10 µl RNase free water directly onto the membrane and incubate for 1 min
• spin full speed for 1 min to elute
• use 1 µl (1:100 works fine) to take OD for cRNA concentration and 260/280 ratio
adjusted cRNA yield = RNAm - (total RNA) * y
total RNA = amount of total RNA used for cDNA synthesis (µg); usually 10µg
y = fraction of cDNA reaction used for in vitro transcription (usually 10µl from a total volume of 12 µl; 10/12 = 0.833)
Affymetrix Probe Synthesis Guidelines, Markus Schmid and Jan Lohmann, MPI Tübingen; page 8 of 8
• 15 µg cRNA(use adjusted cRNA concentration!) in a total volume of 16 µl
• 4 µl 5x fragmentation buffer (provided in Cleanup Module)

It is a good idea to check the quality of the synthesized cRNA and the fragmentation on an agarose gel before wasting a Chip on a bad probe. It is not necessary to run a denaturing RNA gel, but samples should be prepared in a denaturing sample buffer*.

• run the samples side by side on a 2% agarose gel prepared in 1x TAE, use 1kb marker (GibcoBRL) as a standard.
3µl RNA dye (50% glycerol containing 12.5mg/ml BPB and XC, each)
